sentences.sContent: The company has identified 60 potential customers.
sentences.sCn: 该公司已确定了60位潜在的客户。

sentences.sContent: ...have enormous potential to develop renewables...
...Even major fossil fuel exporting countries have great potential to develop renewable energies...
...and there is significant development potential in many other places...
...robots can be programmed to perceive potential perils...
...There is a large potential for wastewater agriculture to both help and hurt great numbers of urban consumers...
...In spite of the potential of machines to replace workers...
...Other countries have much more graphic detail of the potential dangers of smoking...
...and balance these great innovations with the potential downsides they naturally carry with them...
...the potential liability they now face is dramatically greater...
...The potential liability for retailers using magstripe is far more costly than upgrading their registers...
...Some doctors see a potential conflict in trying to be both providers of patient care and financial overseers...
...There are gaps in career choice that should be narrower — if we really want to maximize human potential and American economic growth...
...changed the potential yield of Mexican wheat dramatically...
...The potential to provide 60-100% more food by simply eliminating losses...
...By harnessing the economic potential of all women...
...wanted a better feel for its potential donors...
...When we liberate the economic potential of women...
...they generated a lot of ideas about the nature of the problems and about what potential solutions would look like...
...We see the potential for capture and storage to play an integral role in reducing emissions...
...That’s why I’ve rid my cupboard of microwave food packed in bags coated with a potential cancer-causing substance...
...the more likely it is to find out the artistic potential hidden in them...
...but psychological problems are able to bring potential threats...
...They are worried about the potential danger if the dam should break...
...Knight convinced the company’s officials of the potential for its product in the U...

trans.tranOther: likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future
the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect
